snippet: Police guards around Chinese buildings in Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh City effectively ended a week of protests over a Chinese oil rig in disputed waters.
abstract: Vietnamese government stops anti-Chinese demonstrators from gathering outside Chinese Embassy in Hanoi, deploying large number of police officers around building; actions follow week of violent protests prompted by presence of Chinese oil rig in disputed waters of South China Sea, where conflict between countries continues.

byline.contributor: Chris Buckley contributed reporting from Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam.

lead_paragraph: Police guards around Chinese buildings in Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh City effectively ended a week of protests over a Chinese oil rig in disputed waters.

headline.main: Vietnamese Police Block Anti-Chinese Demonstrators After Violence Over Oil Rig
headline.print_headline: Vietnamese Police Block Anti-Chinese Demonstrators After Violence Over Oil Rig
